comment.author: 63385174@N06
comment._content:
Port Jackson & Manly Steam Ship Company Kurraba Point workshops.
Manly ferries from left are PS Brighton (twin funnels), PS Brightside and PS Fairlight at right. It can be assumed these were the reserve boats at the time of the photograph whilst the more modern vessels were on the Manly run. That, and the appearance of the ship at anchor, makes me think the photograph is c1905.
The workshops were established here in 1886 and moved to Balmain in 1965.
